alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Montgomery; Walker; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Burleson, Grimes, southeastern Brazos, northeastern Washington, northwestern Montgomery and southwestern Walker Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 400 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Huntsville State Park to 9 miles east of Anderson to near Navasota to near Snook. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern College Station, Navasota, Washington, New Waverly, Montgomery, Snook, Millican, Anderson, Dobbin, Independence, Dacus, Plantersville, Wellborn, Roans Prairie, Richards and Carlos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Montgomery; Walker; Washington
